resources:
Opzioni Ordina Sono grato per… Elimina Salva Il tag non può essere vuoto Il corpo del messaggio non può essere vuoto Modifica Ordina & tags Per data Per likes./gra Tags Tutti Taggami (e.g. Amici) Per cosa sei grato? Ehilà! Inizia scrivendo qualcosa per cui sei grato! Widget Notifiche Aggiorna voti 5 minuti 30 minuti Ogni ora 4 ore 8 ore Due volte al giorno Giornalmente Note gratificanti come notifiche Show random grateful notes as a permanent notification Condividi A proposito di Gratus Gratus is a simple app to promote good vibes and positivity. It offers a simple interface to encourage to write about the things we're most grateful for.

The feeling of being grateful is often associated with happiness and good mental health. Quoting Dr. Robert Emmons, professor of Psychology at the University of California "There are many things in our lives, both large and small, that we might be grateful about". Gratus will help you remember about these things and make you smile every time you're reminded of them.

Gratus is dedicated to my sister and my girlfriend, for whom I'm very grateful. Promemoria giornaliero About the things you're most grateful for from the day Tempo d'allerta Per cosa sei grato oggi? Write down what made today special! Sicurezza Blocco applicazione Protect your Gratus notes from prying eyes Inizia ad impostare una password Salva Crea una password Cambia la tua password Sei sicuro di voler eliminare questa nota? si cancella External Storage Write permission is needed to save the pictures you take with Gratus to your device's storage Concedi Nega You'll be able to use your fingerprint to unlock. The passcode is required just in case the fingerprint doesn't work or is inaccessible somehow Info Info sull'app Illustrazioni Superstar doodler La versione premium è richiesta per utilizzare quest'opzione Sblocca tutte le caratteristiche Passcode/fingerprint protection for your personal notes Daily reminder to write about something you're grateful for the day Show notes in a widget, refreshing every N hours/minutes and configurable) Ability to show grateful notes in the notification panel, refreshing every N hours/minutes (user configurable) Upgrade to get all these magical features 🙂 È necessario il premium per utilizzare questo Enter a new 4 to 6 digit passcode Passcode is too small. It needs to be at least 4 digits long Password sbagliata You can't reuse the same passcode Verifica la tua nuova passowrd Le password non corrispondono Entra in Gratus Posiziona il tuo dito sul sensore Utilizza password Conferma la tua password Are you enjoying Gratus so far? Care to give it a rating in the Play Store? certo non ora Vuoi condividere una risposta che renderà migliore Gratus? no grazie no Dismissible notification Allows a grateful notification to be dismissed. You'll still be prompted every refresh %1$s Where are my notes being saved to? All the notes you post on Gratus are saved to your device's local storage, private Gratus data directory. They are inaccessible by normal means since Android protects app's private data with SELinux and strict permissions. %1$s How to backup my notes? Currently Gratus uses Android's built-in backup system that was introduced with Android Marshmallow, so if you wipe your device and start anew you can restore everything back to what it was. In a future update a more transparent backup functionality will be implemented, probably Google Drive. %1$s What is the heart/like counter for? It serves two purposes. One is to encourage you to come back to Gratus and re-read older grateful notes and eventually "like" them again. Second is influencing how often notes appear in the notification/widget. More "likes" equal a higher chance on having those notes show up. Also since you can sort the notes list by "likes" instead of date, when you open the app you will see your favorite notes right on top %1$s Why isn't Gratus translated to my language? Translating apps is costly because of the initial investment (lots of words to begin with) but with every update new strings are added that need to be translated (and it costs more money than the one time in-app purchase to unlock all the features). I make use of crowd sourcing and good will of amazing users that use their own free time to translate these strings for free. Eventually the app will be localized into the most common languages. If you want to help send me an e-mail
